name: Thoughtful Money
title: Weekly Market Recap A Disappointing Year Ahead For Investors
text:
Synopsis
The stock market in 2024 saw exceptional performance, but 2025 is likely to be more challenging, with potential for increased volatility and a possible mean reversion in market returns.

Key Insights
- The stock market delivered over 20% returns for the second consecutive year in 2024
- Market concentration was extremely high, with the "Mega 7" market-cap companies returning 50%, while the S&P 500 was up 22% and Russell 2000 only rose 12%
- Massive ETF inflows ($913 billion year-to-date in 2024) contributed to market performance, with top 10 stocks comprising roughly 40% of ETF holdings
- Forward earnings estimates are optimistic, projecting 19% earnings growth to $249/share, which is $68/share above the long-term historical growth trend
- Analysts warn of potential risks in 2025, including:
  - Potential decline in earnings expectations
  - Need for sustained economic growth
  - Potential impact of Federal Reserve rate cuts
- Current market valuations are high at 27x earnings, making them difficult to sustain
- Potential for market correction exists, with historical patterns suggesting periods of high returns are often followed by below-average returns
- Investors are advised to be cautious, manage risk, and be prepared for increased market volatility in 2025
